In the context of XWiki, the "Bell" icon in the top right corner is not available by default, nor does it appear when the "Alert Notification" extension is installed. This icon is part of the Notifications Application, which you can install from the XWiki Extension Manager.

Once installed, the Notifications Application will allow you to display notifications about events happening in the wiki and select some types of notifications that you will receive by email. You can configure the frequency of your email notifications by using the selector at the bottom of the notification preferences pane in your profile page.

For more information about the Notifications Application and its features, you can refer to the [Notifications Application documentation](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/).

Regarding the "Bell" icon, it is not present by default, and the XWiki platform does not provide a built-in "Alert Notification" extension. However, you can install the Notifications Application to manage and receive notifications about events happening in the wiki.

# Other Features

Other features can be added to your wiki by [installing](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Extension%20Manager%20Application) extensions not listed above. Check the [Extensions wiki](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/) for a full list of available extensions.

# What's New

XWiki 15.1+ The [What's New Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WhatsNewUI/) allows you to get notified about news regarding XWiki.

## Emails

You can also select some types of notifications that you will receive by email. You can have different choices enabled by email and in the menu. Then, on the very bottom of the page, you can select the interval between 2 emails. For example, if you choose "Daily" (default), you will receive one email every day with the recap of the events that have happened during the day. Of course, if there were no activity in this period of time, no email is sent. 

Live notifications emails can be sent to a user. The wiki administrator can also define a "grace time" for live email notifications ; when an event that triggers a notification is sent, the platform will wait for the duration of this grace time before sending a notification email. If during this interval, a new event of the same kind is sent, the two events will be grouped in the same email. You can get more informations on how to configure this feature [here](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/#HCustomizeliveemailnotificationsgracetime).

Of course, it works only if the user has properly filled her e-mail address.

You can edit the frequency of your email notifications by using the selector just at the bottom of the notification preferences pane in your profile page :

![notificationPreferencesEmailUI.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notificationPreferencesEmailUI.png?rev=1.4)

The notifications are sorted by pages and dates, and a table of content summarizes all notifications contained in the email:

![NotifEmailTOC.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotifEmailTOC.png?rev=1.3)

A breadcrumb is displayed on top of each notification that concern a page:

![NotifEmailBreadcrumb.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotifEmailBreadcrumb.png?rev=1.3)
